intro: Pecluma curvans, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiraling growth pattern, with stems that twist and curl in a zigzag manner. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by small, round berries. Pecluma curvans is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
